text.section: Upon the customer's request, the licensee shall provide the customer with advance notice of a pesticide application.

section.section: A licensee or public agency permittee applying a pesticide to a lawn or to exterior landscape plants shall post at the time of application a sign.
The sign shall remain 48 hours following the pesticide application, after which time the customer is responsible for the removal of the sign.
A person may not remove, alter, or deface the sign or agree or conspire with another to remove, alter, or deface the sign within 48 hours of its posting.

The customer or licensee may not be held liable for any penalty for sign removal under this subtitle if the sign is removed by another person or cause over which the customer or licensee has no control.

The sign shall:
Be clearly visible either from the principal place of access to the property; or
Be clearly visible on the portion of the property where the pesticide is applied.
The sign shall contain a uniform statement approved by the Department.
